TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Viewport3DVisual extends System.Windows.Media.Visual

Docs.summary: Renders the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"> children within the specified 2D viewport bounds.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Viewport3DVisual is a 2D Visual with 3D children. The Viewport3DVisual provides necessary infrastructure for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewport3D> element. Most users will want to use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewport3D> element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"> class.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("BitmapEffects are deprecated and no longer function. Consider using Effects where appropriate instead.")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect"> applied to the Viewport3DVisual.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Bitmap effects are software-rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("BitmapEffects are deprecated and no longer function. Consider using Effects where appropriate instead.")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput"> applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput> applies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect> given in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.BitmapEffect%2A> property to a specified region of the visual object.
Bitmap effects are software-rendered. Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software. Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera"> used by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the clipping region of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">.
Docs.value: <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Geometry"> that defines the clipping area.

Docs.summary: Gets the bounding box for the contents of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">.

Gets the union of all of the content bounding boxes for all of the descendants of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">, but not including the contents of the Viewport3DVisual.

Docs.returns: The hit test result of the visual returned as a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.HitTestResult"> type.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Gets or sets the offset value of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">.
Docs.value: <xref:System.Windows.Vector> that represents the offset value of the Viewport3DVisual.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">.
Docs.value: The value of the Opacity property is expressed as a value between 0 and 1, specifying a range from fully transparent to fully opaque. A value of 0 indicates that the Opacity is completely transparent, while a value of 1 indicates that the Opacity is completely opaque. A value 0.5 would indicate the Opacity is 50% opaque, a value of 0.725 would indicate the Opacity is 72.5% opaque, and so on. Values less than 0 are treated as 0, while values greater than 1 are treated as 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the opacity mask value of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual">.
Docs.value: <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Brush"> that represents the opacity mask value of the Viewport3DVisual.

Gets or sets the rectangle in which the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"> will be rendered.
Docs.value: Rectangle in which the contents of the Viewport3D will be rendered.
